The company offers the industryâ€™s most trusted portfolio of creative execution and world-wide business process consulting, with services designed to lower environmental impact. With 22,000 clients, including 93% of the Fortune 100, and 32,000 employees across 28 countries, RRD brings the expertise, execution, and scale designed to transform customer touchpoints into meaningful moments of impact.Job DescriptionRRD is seeking an energetic, enthusiastic & motivated student to join our team in Warrenville, IL this Summer as a Unix/Linux Engineer Intern! ***THIS IS A HYBRID POSITION*** Position SummaryThe Intern position is for a candidate wishing to go into information technology and specifically the Linux space. The candidate will learn a number of tasks and responsibilities that are performed / adhered to by the rest of the team on a day-to-day business. In addition, they may become involved in project work which would help them learn skills valuable to an engineer/architect on an ongoing basis.The candidate will work in the Linux team that supports projects and operations which will include Linux operating systems, process automations and scripts designed to ensure continued functioning of applications. Other key functions will include, participating in design, building virtual and physical servers, monitoring, performance tuning, level 1-2 investigation and resolution of system incidents and problems. ResponsibilitiesResponsible for working with different business units to support the businesses and operational functions in one or more of the following areas: Network Infrastructure, Telecommunications Systems, Electronic Mail and Messaging infrastructure, operating system environments, or enterprise storage and backup. Engineer solutions for new systems and enhancements to existing systems.Configure hardware and software for the corporate and production infrastructuresProviding IT operational support of the enterprise Linux environment by working with other team members with responsibilities for design, patching and other maintenance duties of all Linux systems.Resolves routine problems with assistance or independently . Applies technical abilities to recognize, research, isolate, and resolve basic hardware and software problems. Develop Linux Scripts and utilities.Document and adhere to departmental standards and policiesLearn to troubleshoot and resolve complex Linux issuesConform and comply with audit policies and proceduresProvide status and issue updates to managers and peers as requiredAssist in the automation and consolidation of processes using Ansible/Ansible playbooksPerforms other related duties and participates in special projects as assigned QualificationsCollege level courses in the discipline of computer science or other relevant certification or work experience.Up to 2 years of relevant work experience OR demonstrated ability to meet the job requirements through a comparable number of years of applicable work experience.Exposure and/or experience in the following Linux environment; Red Hat, SuSe, CentOS, Oracle Linux, and AlmaLinux operating systems (typical versions are 7.x/8.x/9.x for RHEL or similar - 12.x for SuSE).Able to translate previous coursework or work experience into problem-solving skills and appropriately apply proven solutions. Apply existing processes and procedures to solve problems and may receive guidance for problems that are non-routine.Requires good communication skills, both verbal and written. Additional InformationThe rate of pay for this role at the noted location is $24.00 / hour. In addition to base pay, depending on the role, the total compensation package may also include overtime, shift differential, call-in, and stand-by pay. RRD offers benefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage, paid time off, disability insurance, 401(k) with match, life insurance and other voluntary supplemental insurance coverages, plus tuition assistance, maternity leave, adoption assistance, and employer/partner discounts.All employment offers are contingent upon the successful completion of both a pre-employment background and drug screen.
